page.title: 02Housing
page.content: The{housing}stock in this area dates back to the timber framing of the fifteen hundreds and clay lump of the eighteenth century,but there are many newer ones. Houses now are{built}of brick and mainly have a pantile roof,a chimney,central heating and some have double glazing.Almost every house has a bathroom and indoor{toilet.}The {gardens }of the older houses are usually large,ranging from one third to two acres;in the newer houses it is the custom to squash in as many houses as possible into one piece of land so gardens are much smaller. Older property in the area is much in demand,and many older houses are being renovated.
